maml:description.maml:para: Get the properties of a Storage Account
This cmdlet allows you to get the properties of a specified Storage Account or all Storage Accounts within a Resource Group or the subscription.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, storage, container, account

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get a specified storage account --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> #Get one storage account Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "rg1" -AccountName "mystorageaccount"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get all Storage Accounts in a Resource Group --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Get all Storage Accounts in a Resource Group Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "rg1"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get all Storage Accounts in the subscription --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Get all Storage Accounts in the subscription Get-AzureRmStorageAccount

maml:description.maml:para: Allows you to create a new Storage Account using the ARM deployment model
This cmdlet allows you to create a new Storage Account using the ARM deployment model.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account

SkuName of Storage Account. Valid values are • Standard_LRS (Locally-redundant storage) • Standard_ZRS (Zone-redundant storage) • Standard_GRS (Geo-redundant storage) • Standard_RAGRS (Read access geo-redundant storage) • Premium_LRS (Premium Locally-redundant storage)
Location of the Storage Account

Kind of Storage Account. Valid values are: • Storage (General-purpose storage account which supports storing Blobs, Tables, Queues, Files and Disks) • BlobStorage (Blob storage account which supports storing Blobs only) Default is Storage.

Access Tier for Blob Storage Accounts. This is mandatory when Storage Account Kind is equal to BlobStorage. Setting this will fail if Storage Account Kind is equal to Storage. Valid values are: • Hot • Cool
The name of the custom domain.
Indicates whether or not indirect CName validation is enabled.
This will enable Storage Service Encryption on the specified Azure Storage Service. Azure Blob and Azure File Services are supported.
Tags to set on the storage account.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account

SkuName of Storage Account. Valid values are • Standard_LRS (Locally-redundant storage) • Standard_ZRS (Zone-redundant storage) • Standard_GRS (Geo-redundant storage) • Standard_RAGRS (Read access geo-redundant storage) • Premium_LRS (Premium Locally-redundant storage)
Location of the Storage Account

Kind of Storage Account. Valid values are: • Storage (General-purpose storage account which supports storing Blobs, Tables, Queues, Files and Disks) • BlobStorage (Blob storage account which supports storing Blobs only) Default is Storage.

Access Tier for Blob Storage Accounts. This is mandatory when Storage Account Kind is equal to BlobStorage. Setting this will fail if Storage Account Kind is equal to Storage. Valid values are: • Hot • Cool
The name of the custom domain.
Indicates whether or not indirect CName validation is enabled.
This will enable Storage Service Encryption on the specified Azure Storage Service. Azure Blob and Azure File Services are supported.
Tags to set on the storage account.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, storage, container, account

Specifies which key to regenerate. Supported value set: - “key1” - “key2”

maml:description.maml:para: Set the Current Azure Storage Account.
Designates the specified storage account as the "current Storage Account". The "current Storage Account" is the Storage Account that is used by default in the current Windows PowerShell session.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
Azure Storage Context of "current Storage Account". You can create it by New-AzureStorageContext cmdlet.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
Azure Storage Context of "current Storage Account". You can create it by New-AzureStorageContext cmdlet.
Update the Storage Account properties
This cmdlet allows you to update the Storage Account properties.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
Force to Set the Account

Specifies the account SkuName of the storage account. The available options are: • Standard_LRS (Locally-redundant storage) • Standard_ZRS (Zone-redundant storage) • Standard_GRS (Geo-redundant storage) • Standard_RAGRS (Read access geo-redundant storage) • Premium_LRS (Premium Locally-redundant storage)
Note that Standard_ZRS, Premium_LRS accounts cannot be changed to other account types, and other account types cannot be changed to Standard_ZRS, Premium_LRS.

Access Tier for Blob Storage Accounts. Changing the access tier may result in additional charges. See (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=786482) to learn more. Setting this will fail if Storage Account Kind is equal to Storage. Valid values are: • Hot • Cool
The name of the custom domain.
Indicates whether or not indirect CName validation is enabled.
This will enable Storage Service Encryption on the specified Azure Storage Service. Azure Blob and Azure File Services are supported.
This will disable Storage Service Encryption on the specified Azure Storage Service. Azure Blob and Azure File Services are supported.
Tags to set on the storage account.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
Force to Set the Account

Specifies the account SkuName of the storage account. The available options are: • Standard_LRS (Locally-redundant storage) • Standard_ZRS (Zone-redundant storage) • Standard_GRS (Geo-redundant storage) • Standard_RAGRS (Read access geo-redundant storage) • Premium_LRS (Premium Locally-redundant storage)
Note that Standard_ZRS, Premium_LRS accounts cannot be changed to other account types, and other account types cannot be changed to Standard_ZRS, Premium_LRS.

Access Tier for Blob Storage Accounts. Changing the access tier may result in additional charges. See (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=786482) to learn more. Setting this will fail if Storage Account Kind is equal to Storage. Valid values are: • Hot • Cool
The name of the custom domain.
Indicates whether or not indirect CName validation is enabled.
This will enable Storage Service Encryption on the specified Azure Storage Service. Azure Blob and Azure File Services are supported.
This will disable Storage Service Encryption on the specified Azure Storage Service. Azure Blob and Azure File Services are supported.
Tags to set on the storage account.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, storage, container, account

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Set Storage SkuName --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Set SkuName Set-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "myresourcegroup" -AccountName "mystorageaccount" - SkuName "Standard_RAGRS"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Set Custom Domain and Tags --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Set custom domain and Tags Set-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "myresourcegroup" -AccountName "mystorageaccount" -CustomDomainName "www.domainname.com" –UseSubDomain $true -Tag @{tag0="value0";tag1="value1";tag2="value2"}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Enable Storage Service Encryption on Blob and File Services --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Enable Blob and File Storage Services Encryption Set-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "myresourcegroup" -AccountName "mystorageaccount" –EnableEncryptionService "Blob,File"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Set Access Tier to cool --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Set Access Tier to cool Set-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "myresourcegroup" -AccountName "mycoolstorageaccount" -AccessTier "cool"

maml:description.maml:para: Update the NetworkAcls property of a Storage Account
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
The Bypass value to update to the NetworkAcls property of a Storage Account. The allowed value are none or any combination of: • Logging • Metrics • Azureservices
The DefaultAction value to update to the NetworkAcls property of a Storage Account. The allowed Options: • Allow • Deny
The Array of IpRule objects to update to the NetworkAcls Property of a Storage Account.
The Array of VirtualNetworkRule objects to update to the NetworkAcls Property of a Storage Account.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
The Bypass value to update to the NetworkAcls property of a Storage Account. The allowed value are none or any combination of: • Logging • Metrics • Azureservices
The DefaultAction value to update to the NetworkAcls property of a Storage Account. The allowed Options: • Allow • Deny
The Array of IpRule objects to update to the NetworkAcls Property of a Storage Account.
The Array of VirtualNetworkRule objects to update to the NetworkAcls Property of a Storage Account.
